{{Use dmy dates|date=August 2011}} {{Use Australian English|date=August 2011}} {{Radio station | image =| name = 999 ABC Broken Hill| callsign = 2NB| airdate = 29 July 1948 | frequency = 999 [[Kilohertz|kHz]] [[amplitude modulation|AM]] | area = [[Broken Hill, New South Wales|Broken Hill]]| owner = [[Australian Broadcasting Corporation]] | format = [[Talk radio|Talk]] | website = [http://www.abc.net.au/brokenhill/ http://www.abc.net.au/brokenhill/] | }} [[File:ABC Broken Hill studios.jpg|thumb|right|ABC Broken Hill studios]] '''999 ABC Broken Hill''' is an [[ABC Local Radio]] station based in [[Broken Hill, New South Wales|Broken Hill]] and broadcasting to the surrounding [[outback]] region in [[New South Wales]], including the towns of [[Menindee, New South Wales|Menindee]], [[White Cliffs, New South Wales|White Cliffs]] and [[Silverton, New South Wales|Silverton]]. The station began as '''2NB''' in [[1948]], originally broadcasting on 760 AM. It now broadcasts on the main [[AM Broadcasting|AM]] frequency of 999 [[Kilohertz|kHz]] along with a low power FM repeater. ==Local programming== '''Weekdays'''
